intro: Sphaeralcea bonariensis, commonly known as the Argentine catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its annual growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Sphaeralcea bonariensis is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
